intro: Ekebergia arborea, commonly known as the African wild almond, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The tree produces small, edible pods that contain seeds used in traditional medicine. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in savanna ecosystems. Its botanical features make it an important plant for both ecological and medicinal purposes.
